info.description:
Description of Instagram RESTful API.
Current limitations:
  * Instagram service does not support [cross origin headers](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Access_control_CORS)
  for security reasons, therefore it is not possible to use Swagger UI and make API calls directly from browser.
  * Modification API requests (`POST`, `DELETE`) require additional security [scopes](https://instagram.com/developer/authorization/)
  that are available for Apps [created on or after Nov 17, 2015](http://instagram.com/developer/review/) and
  started in [Sandbox Mode](http://instagram.com/developer/sandbox/).
  * Consider the [Instagram limitations](https://instagram.com/developer/limits/) for API calls that depends on App Mode.

**Warning:** For Apps [created on or after Nov 17, 2015](http://instagram.com/developer/changelog/) API responses
containing media objects no longer return the `data` field in `comments` and `likes` nodes.

Last update: 2015-11-28
info.title: Instagram

tags.description: Relationships to other users outgoing and incoming
tags.name: relationships

get.description:
Get recent media from a geography subscription that you created.
**Note:** You can only access Geographies that were explicitly created by your OAuth client. Check the
Geography Subscriptions section of the [real-time updates page](https://instagram.com/developer/realtime/).
When you create a subscription to some geography that you define, you will be returned a unique `geo-id` that
can be used in this query. To backfill photos from the location covered by this geography, use the
[media search endpoint](https://instagram.com/developer/endpoints/media/).
**Warning:** [Deprecated](http://instagram.com/developer/changelog/) for Apps created **on or after** Nov 17, 2015

parameters.description: The geography ID.
parameters.name: geo-id

parameters.description: Max number of media to return.
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: Return media before this `min_id`.
parameters.name: min_id

200.description: List of recent media entries from a geography subscription.

get.summary: Get recent media from a custom geo-id.

get.description: Search for a location by geographic coordinate.

parameters.description: Default is 1000m (distance=1000), max distance is 5000.
parameters.name: distance

parameters.description: Returns a location mapped off of a Facebook places id. If used, a Foursquare id and `lat`, `lng` are not required.
parameters.name: facebook_places_id

parameters.description:
Returns a location mapped off of a foursquare v1 api location id. If used, you are not required to use
`lat` and `lng`. Note that this method is deprecated; you should use the new foursquare IDs with V2 of their API.
parameters.name: foursquare_id

parameters.description: Latitude of the center search coordinate. If used, `lng` is required.
parameters.name: lat

parameters.description: Longitude of the center search coordinate. If used, `lat` is required.
parameters.name: lng

parameters.description:
Returns a location mapped off of a foursquare v2 api location id. If used, you are not required to use
`lat` and `lng`.
parameters.name: foursquare_v2_id

get.summary: Search for a location by geographic coordinate.

get.description: Get information about a location.

parameters.description: The location ID.
parameters.name: location-id

get.summary: Get information about a location.

get.description: Get a list of recent media objects from a given location.

parameters.description: The location ID.
parameters.name: location-id

parameters.description: Return media after this UNIX timestamp.
parameters.name: min_timestamp

parameters.description: Return media before this UNIX timestamp.
parameters.name: max_timestamp

parameters.description: Return media before this `min_id`.
parameters.name: min_id

parameters.description: Return media after this `max_id`.
parameters.name: max_id

200.description: List of media entries from this location.

get.summary: Get a list of recent media objects from a given location.

get.description:
Get a list of what media is most popular at the moment. Can return mix of `image` and `video` types.
**Warning:** [Deprecated](http://instagram.com/developer/changelog/) for Apps created **on or after** Nov 17, 2015
get.summary: Get a list of currently popular media.

get.description:
Search for media in a given area. The default time span is set to 5 days. The time span must not exceed 7 days.
Defaults time stamps cover the last 5 days. Can return mix of `image` and `video` types.

parameters.description: Latitude of the center search coordinate. If used, `lng` is required.
parameters.name: lat

parameters.description: Longitude of the center search coordinate. If used, `lat` is required.
parameters.name: lng

parameters.description: A unix timestamp. All media returned will be taken later than this timestamp.
parameters.name: min_timestamp

parameters.description: A unix timestamp. All media returned will be taken earlier than this timestamp.
parameters.name: max_timestamp

parameters.description: Default is 1km (distance=1000), max distance is 5km.
parameters.name: distance

200.description: Found media resources (without likes information) in a given area.

get.summary: Search for media in a given area.

get.description:
This endpoint returns the same response as `GET /media/{media-id}`.
A media object's shortcode can be found in its shortlink URL. An example shortlink is
`http://instagram.com/p/D/`, its corresponding shortcode is `D`.

parameters.description: The short code of the media resource.
parameters.name: shortcode

get.summary: Get information about a media object.

get.description:
Get information about a media object. The returned type key will allow you to differentiate between image and
video media.
**Note:** if you authenticate with an OAuth Token, you will receive the user_has_liked key which quickly tells
you whether the current user has liked this media item.

parameters.description: The ID of the media resource.
parameters.name: media-id

get.summary: Get information about a media object.

get.description: Get a list of recent comments on a media object.

parameters.description: The ID of the media resource.
parameters.name: media-id

200.description: List of comments of the media resource.

get.summary: Get a list of recent comments on a media object.

post.description:
Create a comment on a media object with the following rules:

  * The total length of the comment cannot exceed 300 characters.
  * The comment cannot contain more than 4 hashtags.
  * The comment cannot contain more than 1 URL.
  * The comment cannot consist of all capital letters.

parameters.description: The ID of the media resource.
parameters.name: media-id

parameters.description: Text to post as a comment on the media object as specified in `media-id`.
parameters.name: text

post.summary: Create a comment on a media object.

delete.description: Remove a comment either on the authenticated user's media object or authored by the authenticated user.

parameters.description: The ID of the media resource.
parameters.name: media-id

parameters.description: The ID of the comment entry.
parameters.name: comment-id

delete.description: Remove a like on this media by the currently authenticated user.

parameters.description: The ID of the media resource.
parameters.name: media-id

delete.summary: Remove a like on this media by the current user.

get.description: Get a list of users who have liked this media.

parameters.description: The ID of the media resource.
parameters.name: media-id

200.description: List of users who liked the media resource.

get.summary: Get a list of users who have liked this media.

post.description: Set a like on this media by the currently authenticated user.

parameters.description: The ID of the media resource.
parameters.name: media-id

post.summary: Set a like on this media by the current user.

get.description: Search for tags by name.

parameters.description: A valid tag name without a leading \#. (eg. snowy, nofilter)
parameters.name: q

200.description: List of found tags and their statistics.

get.summary: Search for tags by name.

get.description: Get information about a tag object.

parameters.description: The tag name.
parameters.name: tag-name

get.summary: Get information about a tag object.

get.description:
Get a list of recently tagged media. Use the `max_tag_id` and `min_tag_id` parameters in the pagination
response to paginate through these objects.

parameters.description: The tag name.
parameters.name: tag-name

parameters.description: Count of tagged media to return.
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: Return media before this `min_tag_id`.
parameters.name: min_tag_id

parameters.description: Return media after this `max_tag_id`.
parameters.name: max_tag_id

200.description: List of media entries with this tag.

get.summary: Get a list of recently tagged media.

get.description: Search for a user by name.

parameters.description: A query string.
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: Number of users to return.
parameters.name: count

get.summary: Search for a user by name.

get.description:
See the authenticated user's feed.
**Warning:** [Deprecated](http://instagram.com/developer/changelog/) for Apps created **on or after** Nov 17, 2015

parameters.description: Count of media to return.
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: Return media later than this `min_id`.
parameters.name: min_id

parameters.description: Return media earlier than this `max_id`.
parameters.name: max_id

get.summary: See the authenticated user's feed.

get.description:
See the list of media liked by the authenticated user. Private media is returned as long as the authenticated
user has permission to view that media. Liked media lists are only available for the currently authenticated
user.

parameters.description: Count of media to return.
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: Return media liked before this id.
parameters.name: max_like_id

get.summary: See the list of media liked by the authenticated user.

get.description: List the users who have requested this user's permission to follow.

200.description: List of users who have requested this user's permission to follow.

get.summary: List the users who have requested this user's permission to follow.

get.description:
Get basic information about a user. To get information about the owner of the access token, you can use
**self** instead of the `user-id`.
Security scope `public_content` is required to read information about other users.

parameters.description: The ID of a user to get information about, or **self** to retrieve information about authenticated user.
parameters.name: user-id

404.description: Not Found, user with such ID does not exist.

get.summary: Get basic information about a user.

get.description:
Get the list of users this user is followed by. To get users followed by the owner of the access token, you
can use **self** instead of the `user-id`.

parameters.description: The ID of a user, or **self** to retrieve information about authenticated user.
parameters.name: user-id

200.description: List of users this user is followed by.

get.summary: Get the list of users this user is followed by.

get.description:
Get the list of users this user follows. To get follows of the owner of the access token, you can use **self**
instead of the `user-id`.

parameters.description: The ID of a user, or **self** to retrieve information about authenticated user.
parameters.name: user-id

200.description: List of users this user follows.

get.summary: Get the list of users this user follows.

get.description:
Get the most recent media published by a user. To get the most recent media published by the owner of the
access token, you can use **self** instead of the `user-id`.
Security scope `public_content` is required to read information about other users.

parameters.description: The ID of a user to get recent media of, or **self** to retrieve media of authenticated user.
parameters.name: user-id

parameters.description: Count of media to return.
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: Return media before this UNIX timestamp.
parameters.name: max_timestamp

parameters.description: Return media after this UNIX timestamp.
parameters.name: min_timestamp

parameters.description: Return media later than this `min_id`.
parameters.name: min_id

parameters.description: Return media earlier than this `max_id`.
parameters.name: max_id

get.summary: Get the most recent media published by a user.

get.description: Get information about a relationship to another user.

parameters.description: The ID of a user to get information about.
parameters.name: user-id

get.summary: Get information about a relationship to another user.

post.description: Modify the relationship between the current user and the target user.

parameters.description: The ID of the target user.
parameters.name: user-id

parameters.description: Type of action to apply for relationship with the user.
parameters.name: action

post.summary: Modify the relationship between the current user and the target user.

count.description: Nember of comments available, data does not necessary contain all comments

data.description: Collection of comment entries; **warning:** deprecated for Apps [created on or after Nov 17, 2015](http://instagram.com/developer/changelog/)

next_cursor.description: The cursor ID of the next page

next_url.description: URL to retrieve next page of entries

next_max_id.description: The max ID of the next page

next_url.description: URL to retrieve next page of entries

count.description: Nember of likes available, data does not necessary contain all comments

data.description: Collection of users who liked; **warning:** deprecated for Apps [created on or after Nov 17, 2015](http://instagram.com/developer/changelog/)

id.description: ID of this location (in some responses it has a type of 'integer')

link.description: Fixed URL of this media entry

tags.description: List of tags assigned to this media

user_has_liked.description: Indicates whether authenticated user has liked this media or not

users_in_photo.description: Users located on this media entry

data.description: Found media entries; some end-points do not return likes informtaion

target_user_is_private.description: Indicates whether target user is private or not

media_count.description: Overall number of media entries taged with this name

data.description: List of media entries with this tag

deprecation_warning.description: The deprication warning, if information is available

min_tag_id.description: The min ID of a tag for the next page

next_max_tag_id.description: The max ID of a tag for the next page

next_url.description: URL to retrieve next page of entries

data.description: List of found tags with brief statistics

followed_by.description: Number of followers of this user

follows.description: Number of users followed by this user

data.description: List of user short information entries

scopes.basic: to read a user's profile info and media (granted by default)
scopes.comments: to post and delete comments on a user's behalf
scopes.follower_list: to read the list of followers and followed-by users
scopes.likes: to like and unlike media on a user's behalf
scopes.public_content: to read any public profile info and media on a user’s behalf
scopes.relationships: to follow and unfollow accounts on a user's behalf
